snippet: The service is at least four years away, but the prospect of Ryanair's eventually entering the trans-Atlantic market can only cause new anxiety for Europe's biggest carriers.
abstract: Ryanair confirms reports that its board has approved loosely formulated plan to begin operating low-cost flights between Europe and the United States; entry of ultracheap carrier entering transatlantic market has ruffled larger airlines; announcement comes ten years after Ryanair first floated idea of providing $10 flights between London and New York.
lead_paragraph: The service is at least four years away, but the prospect of Ryanair's eventually entering the trans-Atlantic market can only cause new anxiety for Europe's biggest carriers.

headline.main: Ryanair Dangles Possibility of Ultracheap Trans-Atlantic Travel
headline.print_headline: $10 Trans-Atlantic Fares a Possibility, Says Ryanair
